page.title: 06TOURISM
page.content: The area is becoming increasingly popular with tourists , perhaps because the Lake District is often rather crowded and the area around Bewcastle remains a haven of peace, with quiet roads and pleasant scenary in addition to the historical associations of the Bewcastle Cross and Roman Fort.There are no hotels in the area but several farms have caravans which they rent out in Summer, there are several establishments on the edge of our rectangle offering self-catering accomodation and two cottages within our survey are used as second-home, holiday accomodation. The lack of a through route probably means the area will never become really popular except with those who seek a quiet,unspoiled spot in the country.
